analysis.career_trajectory: Started with Ruby in 2008, moved to conductor in 2010, and then developed a stripped down Rails bundle for TextMate 2. Recently worked on the Hyprland Wiki Pages project, which involves syncing the website with the wiki.

technical_obsessions.evidence: On basecamp/omarchy: Interesting idea, but we already look for custom themed config files in `~/.config/omarchy/themed`. You can add any .tpl file, and the replacement of variables will be made...

The manual install would be as described here: https://learn.omacom.io/2/the-omarchy-manual/96/manual-installation. User would install arch (using grub), then run your setup script, which would then call the omarchy install after it's setup everything

I looked through all the default themes and liked all of them, even if they're different from before. Except for Kanagawa. There we have an explicit hyprland.conf in the theme file that overwrites it.
